I've been experimenting with JUnit 4 and mostly I like it. I do have a 
few questions:

1. If there are multiple @Before annotated methods in a class, are any 
guarantees made about what order they are invoked in? Same question for 
@After, @BeforeClass, and @AfterClass.

2. Is there any way to control the order in which tests are run? Or is 
that pretty much still up to the test runner like in JUnit 3?

3. Is there any equivalent to the suite() method in JUnit 3? i.e. how do 
I bundle up several different test classes so they can be run as a group?

4. Java 5 is obviously required to build JUnit 4. Can it nonetheless run 
in Java 1.4? or is Java 5 pretty much required for anything that uses 
JUnit 4?

5. The GUI test runners don't appear to be in Version4 CVS. Will they 
return at some point?

6. Why are Assert.failSame, Assert.failNotSame, Assert.failNotEquals(), 
and Assert.format now public?

Any light anyone can shed on these questions would be appreciated. Thanks!

--
